title: inheritance
comment: A birthright or endowment, often in the form of goods or land, passed down from one generation to another. Scripture treats eternal life and other privileges of faith as an inheritance from God.

children.title: inheritance, material
children.comment: Family property was normally handed down in biblical times through sons, with a special place for the firstborn.  The land of Israel was regarded as the nation's inheritance.

children.title: It was normally handed down through sons
The absence of a son as a male heir was seen as a serious disadvantage

secondaryrefs.comment: The son's asking for his inheritance is perhaps to be seen as an insult.

children.title: It must not be fought over
Respect for the inheritance of others
It was confirmed to Moses and the patriarchs
Entry was denied because of sin
It was allotted to the tribes
It was a land for the godly
The LORD's inheritance in the land
The inheritance was lost through sin
The land was regained through grace

primaryrefs.comment: The Jews did return to the land; some look, however, for a further fulfilment of these promises in the future; others see them as fulfilled in Jesus Christ.

children.title: inheritance, spiritual
children.comment: Believers are privileged to receive a spiritual inheritance from their heavenly Father as a result of their adoption into the family of God through faith.

children.title: Believers have an inheritance in Christ
Believers are heirs under the covenant
The nature of the spiritual inheritance of believers
They have the full rights of sons
They have the rights of the firstborn
Their inheritance is the word of God
The permanence of believers' spiritual inheritance
It has been prepared from the creation
It is sealed with God's promise
It is conditional upon continuing obedience and faith
It is denied to the ungodly
